body.head.byline: By MICHAEL COOPER; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: New York State Budget Division reports that official total for state budget for year that began April 1 is $120.7 billion (S)

block.p: If Gov. Eliot Spitzer proposed a $120.6 billion budget, and the State Legislature added $1 billion in new spending before passing it, how big is the enacted budget? The official answer, according to a report issued yesterday by the state's Budget Division, is $120.7 billion. The difference is due to the state's re-estimating how much federal aid it will have on hand in the new fiscal year, which began on April 1.
